channel.title: How to keep
channel.description: Does anyone know how to keep a song playing throughout a whole website without stopping when you switch to a next page? The song file is on my computer, so i'm hosting my music files. I need it for a school project that's due tommorow...=(. I already put songs on it, but the little quicktime player shows up, i put autostart and hidden false. But if i could find out a way to keep it playing, i'll keep it hidden... So any knows? Thanks in advance!

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Unid, notice the percent signs after the numbers. That means the iframe will be 100% of the screen.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

i see where your getting at. lol but 100x100 small

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[code]

wahtever [/code]

Thats combining both codes =].

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Actually, Unid, that would cause the song to restart each time the page changed. Using iframes allows it to continually play throughout the entire website.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

i guess you can understand that… but i guess you would have to put that in every page :P. change the hidden= or autostart=. pretty simple to understand.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Well lol. thanks for your help, i get you now, i was reading on the tag iframe at school in the morning, so that helped too.

Thanks a bunch! =).

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Also, this is nothing personal, but I hate it when people type iframes as iFrames. It stands for inline: it’s not some decorative letter that you put to make your products look more appealing.

Say wha? u mean they dont call it iFrames to be cool like the iPod, iHome, iShitmypants, iHome, iInsertproduct?

well i feel so stupid

j/k

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

xxlegitxx:

And iframes have been supported since IE4, O4, and FF1… I really don’t think its all that necessary anyway to include that line of text.

True, but there’s still people that use Netscape Navigator out there, so you’ve always got to include a little ‘incentive’ to get them to upgrade

xxlegitxx:

Also, this is nothing personal, but I hate it when people type iframes as iFrames. It stands for inline: it’s not some decorative letter that you put to make your products look more appealing.

I find it more readable-ish to type a capital letter (otherwise it looks like “if rame” to me), but I see your point.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:5, topic:152580”]Also a side note, if you’re going for XHTML that validates, remember to give a name attribute to the iFrame, and insert something along the lines of “Your browser does not support iFrames” in between the > and </

So like this:

[/quote]

Yea, thats true, except, if this is a school project, you’d probably build in a better fail-safe than that line of text.

And iframes have been supported since IE4, O4, and FF1… I really don’t think its all that necessary anyway to include that line of text.

Also, this is nothing personal, but I hate it when people type iframes as iFrames. It stands for inline: it’s not some decorative letter that you put to make your products look more appealing.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:4, topic:152580”]Twould be better if I could see what I’m helping you with, either that or explain it a tad better.

This is basically what you should be doing.

wahtever [/quote]

Also a side note, if you’re going for XHTML that validates, remember to give a name attribute to the iFrame, and insert something along the lines of “Your browser does not support iFrames” in between the > and </

So like this:

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Twould be better if I could see what I’m helping you with, either that or explain it a tad better.

This is basically what you should be doing.

wahtever

EDIT: Fixed the frame src.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

The parent page is Aphrodite.html, i put the iframe in there.How would i navigate in the iFrame?

<iframe src="http://192.168.1.2/HomeWork/Once Upon a December.mp3" frameborder="0" height="12"></iframe>

Actually i have to go to sleep now, but keep responding. I will check in the morning, or when i’m at school, if its not X blocked. Thanks btw.

Also, if i end the tag at the end of the page, the background will turn white, while the background that i want it to be is black, so thats worse too.

Read full topic

item.title: How to keep
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Try using iframes, and having it play in the parent page. While you navigate in the iframe, you never change the original page.

Read full topic
